website_summaries.verdict: Inexpensive latex-free gloves that are easy to use, but quality varies.
pros: Finely textured to provide a strong grip
cons: Some buyers had gloves tear on them frequently

customer_reviews.title: Price Gouging
customer_reviews.text: I like these glove back when they were $7.35 for a box of 100. Now that there is a pandemic, you think you can price gouge customers at over $23 a box now. I will not be back until you stop taking advantage of others.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lets You Really Grab Onto Things
customer_reviews.text: I use these when making cold process soap. They fit so much better than regular rubber kitchen gloves and allow me the flexibility I need to grab onto things, open jars or pick up small objects. I don't feel hamstrung like I do wearing rubber gloves. I can usually get several uses out of them before they tear. I have large hands for a woman, and the size large fits me with a little room to spare. Will definitely buy these again when I run out.
customer_reviews.author: Marie McCTop Contributor: Quilting

customer_reviews.title: Too thin, tears way too easily.
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted to like these but I find that I go through them like toilet paper. And I’m just doing regular house cleaning like dusting and washing windows. It might just be a bad batch but there are pinholes in all of them and it doesn’t keep the water/cleaning chemicals from touching my hands. I cannot imagine how Unsafe these would be for someone in a medical environment! Long story short these gloves are crap.
customer_reviews.author: Michael and Erin Maniscalco

customer_reviews.title: I love these gloves. Useful for so many activities.
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves. I used them mostly for cooking but they are perfect for touching anything that you don't necessarily want to stay with you; garlic, hot peppers, greasy meat, shoe polish, paint, etc. I originally ordered the X-Large gloves because that is my normal size. The XL fit comfortably but they are not tight, which is fine because they "fit". However, I found that when it comes to these gloves I prefer them to be more snug so I started ordering Large instead. Just a personal preference. They are durable and inexpensive. I would highly recommend this brand/style.
customer_reviews.author: T. P.

customer_reviews.title: This brand is very thin and tears easily. This isn't necessarily a bad thing but the ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used nitrile gloves professionally for at least 15 years. This brand is very thin and tears easily. This isn't necessarily a bad thing but the consumer needs to be aware. Thinness means you are more sensitive and flexible, which is good. It also means it tears easily and is sensitive to extreme cold/heat/chemicals; obviously bad. I wouldn't work with toxic chemicals, chemo or engine blocks. I would wash delicate china or glassware, apply medications with these gloves. If you want tough, stick with Halyard or Kimberly Clark.
customer_reviews.author: J. owen

customer_reviews.title: I am disabled, I love these for me, my family and the Healthcare workers that wori for me.
customer_reviews.text: I am disabled and receive Home Health Care. I am required to have certain supplies available for my workers. Medical gloves are on of these supplies. These nitrile gloves are great. They are tough enough for my needs. Also, since I do not always know the workers well at first, it avoids the issue of latex allergies. It is also convenient that I can subscribe for automatic deliveries of this item, thus making sure I always have enough on hand. I have been ordering these gloves for quite a while, and I am very happy with them. These gloves and being able to subscribe ordering them suit my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Albert W. Demello, III

customer_reviews.title: Cleaning Staple
customer_reviews.text: I use these when I'm cleaning and they do a great job of keeping my hands from touching toilet germs. I noticed they're a little bit see through when I put them on, which makes me think they might be too thin to be durable, but then they held up through a heavy cleaning session and they're inexpensive, so a moot point, really. Bottom Line: Good choice. I would order them again.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Reiber

customer_reviews.title: Useful for cooking, cleaning, and all sorts of other home uses
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are great for cooking. I'll put on a pair right as I enter my apartment kitchen and begin organizing my work area and won't take them off until food is being brought to the table. Sometimes I wear the gloves when cleaning (especially when scrubbing the toilet), and they're great for that, too!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Thin, but great for food prep
customer_reviews.text: I use Nitrile Gloves in my kitchen for food prep. Mostly for handling raw meat, fish, onions, or anything else that might leave my hands smelly. I started putting on gloves in the kitchen a few years ago and now, for me they are a must have. I keep a box on top my fridge for convenience. Unless you are one that enjoys getting your hands into the food, I highly recommend Nitrile Gloves. These are thinner than what I'm used to. You can almost see threw them. But they were also a couple bucks cheaper than what I usually get. For the money, this is a pretty good deal. They work great for me.
customer_reviews.author: RayS209

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality and thin. Tears easily and almost useless. I put them on to clean and spray paint an item that had no sharp edges, and it was too late when I noticed that one finger had torn. I got black paint around that finger and under my nail. When I tried changing the glove on that hand, the whole glove fell apart before I got it off. The price might be cheap, but in this instance, you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: D'ARCY

customer_reviews.title: BETTER THAN AVERAGE - OK FOR THE PRICE
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered a few boxes of these now, and they seem pretty consistent quality. <<PROS>> - Sizing is accurate for most users. - Snug fit (easy to manipulate equipment) <<CONS>> - Powderless shouldn't mean hard to put on. The material seems to grab the skin, even if dry, making it challenging to put on (critical in emergencies). - Rips easier than others
customer_reviews.author: Majo2469

customer_reviews.title: Wish They Were Longer But Fit and Work Well for My Purposes
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a Medium in these and mostly use them for extra protection when I scoop the cat litter. They work and fit well for that and other purposes. I just wish they came down further on my wrist. So I decided to try a Large to see if they came down any further. The Large didn't offer me any more wrist protection. I don't notice an appreciable difference in length. The main difference in the fit is that the Large is a bit wider and longer in the fingers. I can still use them though, so I won't be returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Felicidad

customer_reviews.title: Way to THIN
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe these get such good reviews. They feel like they are made out of balloon material. They can rip easily. Don't waste your money buy a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: austin girl

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves & not made in China!
customer_reviews.text: Just opened the box today & used a pair to open up some boxes from work. Slim fit, nice color - just what I need them for; opening mail, packages and shopping cart handles. I was just about to order another box and now they have gone up $8+ - smh. Update: They also do not cause your hands to sweat like other gloves!
customer_reviews.author: 2Toned

customer_reviews.title: Very thin!
customer_reviews.text: These are very thin for most applications and you have to use a magnifier to see the micro-texture of the glove. The item weight for each glove as measured is 82 grams, not 3.5 ounces. I guess I can use them for something, I just don't know what.
customer_reviews.author: jl miller

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Product as advertised. Cheaper than the prices fir a box of gloves at a drug store. I use them all the time, especially when cleaning up cat hairballs or anytime I am using a bleach product to clean. Hold up very well and protect my hands from harsh chemicals, body fluids, etc. Have bought several boxes over time & will continue to purchase. No powder on the inside which is a good thing. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Herring

customer_reviews.title: A five star bargain.
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 8.5 glove and the large is the perfect size for me. I love the look and feel. They are easy to put on and take off. They are not too thin, but they are thick enough to be tear resistant. I wear them while oil painting and they do make my hands sweat after wearing for a long time. If not for that, I'd give them 5 stars. If you want to wear them as a barrier for shorter tasks, I'd say they are a 5 star bargain. For the fifteen cents a pair I paid for them, they may be a five star bargain, period.
customer_reviews.author: NIfty Betty

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Do It!!! Bad Quality!!!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible! Don’t waste your money. Extremely thin. Tears easily. I wear them to scan products for customers to buy. Constantly have to replace them because they start falling apart after a few orders. Look good, feel comfortable but no durability. If you buy these, you’ll regret it!
customer_reviews.author: VGIRL50

customer_reviews.title: not worth it
customer_reviews.text: sturdiness is not so good just used a few minutes and both gloves tore all I was doing is putting painters tape to paint when like I said 1 to 2 minutes into project had to change gloves I didn't intend to use a whole box this is as cheep as it gets .
customer_reviews.author: Abbyp

customer_reviews.title: Gloves not sized correctly and made in someone’s basement!
customer_reviews.text: Gloves are very small for large and honestly seem brittle like the shelf life had expired! Ripped off again!
customer_reviews.author: John R. Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Tear easily
customer_reviews.text: These gloves rip while I am trying to put them on. I wear plastic gloves over my beekeeping gloves to help keep my leather gloves from getting sticky. Usually I do not have a problem, however, these gloves always get shredded mid-inspection. Not a good quality glove.
customer_reviews.author: Briggsy

customer_reviews.title: Love these Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I use these gloves all the time. I keep a box under the sink in the bathroom for when I am cleaning the tub and basin to protect my hands from the chemicals. I keep them under the kitchen sink so they are easily accessible when I am preparing food, etc. I generally grab a pair for all kinds of jobs around the house. They are fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: T. Kubala

customer_reviews.title: strong enough
customer_reviews.text: These are reasonably well-made and strong. I use them to make a spelt pizza dough which is like thick glue, so using these makes cleanup much easier. Despite my gloved hands being glued together with the spelt and pulling on the fingers (which stretched them like rubber bands), they didn't break. I wear large dishwashing gloves comfortably (eg Playtex) and these in large fit comparably.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer10

customer_reviews.title: These make your hand's  Stink Like Fish!!
customer_reviews.text: These make my hand's stink like fish! It's so sickening, I'm almost threw up. I didn't know if I was the only one, so I had my best friend try them and it happened to her too. What's going on? I even tried putting on scented hand cream first. They're not very thick either. I bought two boxes. Big mistake!
customer_reviews.author: Desert Summer

customer_reviews.title: Great for light coverage
customer_reviews.text: A perfect glove for what it’s meant to be, light duty. These aren’t intended to be used for lengthy times or hard physical work with the hands. I use them to cover hands after applying ointment for eczema, odd I know but necessary. If you want something for mechanical or yard work try something heavier. Also you can still use a touchscreen with these on.
customer_reviews.author: VolFan

customer_reviews.title: Durable great gloves
customer_reviews.text: I work as a freelance house cleaner. These gloves are easy to put on. Durable during intense scrubbing. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: KayDnaleri

customer_reviews.title: Best gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Should have bought more of these before the pandemic! They are great. No residue left on your hands, no smell or irritation and fit comfortably while using.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Handy
customer_reviews.text: Handy item. No pun intended. I’ve been using these more frequently. I put a pair in my pocket on Saturday morning and it saves me from cleaning oil, grease or some other foreign substance from my hands. I use them when I am working with my tools or grill or boat etc. after a short while your hands get very sweaty. No problem. I just take them off throw them away and grab another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Nitrile Gloves Are Not Just For Medical Use
customer_reviews.text: Bought these before, except in black. Nitrile gloves are great. I do not use them for medical use, but to protect my hands when using leather dye. They are strong enough to use when working on vehicle engines to prevent grease and oil stains, especially under fingernails. It would be a good idea to keep a few in your medical kit.
customer_reviews.author: KAL

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware - NOT Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: These are in NO WAY Heavy Duty. If you do not want chemicals/contaminants getting on your hands choose another brand. We purchased these for general household use (Not heavy duty) however almost every glove tore even though the appropriate size was ordered. After this happened the first few times, I looked on the box and came back to this page to look for the Mil grade -- there isn't one. Since I typically use another brand that is marked 5 Mil and have never had an issue, I would say this brand is 3 mil or less.
customer_reviews.author: Eva

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, good price, good for me!
customer_reviews.text: I really like these gloves. They are easy to put on, fit great (a little roomier than other brands), and have not torn or broken while using them. I did find one that was already torn in the box. I also like that the box is smaller, but still holds 100, and they are easy to get out of the box. I'm glad I found them, they work well for personal care, and are less expensive than other brands I have purchased in the past.
customer_reviews.author: LikesAngels

customer_reviews.title: gloves fit well
customer_reviews.text: Was concerned after reading the 1 star reviews. We are all different. Large fits me perfect. I have large arthritic hands and can't stand gloves to fit snug but fit. I would try on gloves in a store first!!! They are true to size in my opinion. I'm average as far as size goes, 10 straight slim pants,, large tops, 8 1/2 foot. 5'7". medium to large bones
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Bowen

customer_reviews.title: CACA is good spanish term for this product that may be acceptable to the censors
customer_reviews.text: If you want good gloves you buy nitrile. These are a bit substandard. Not acceptable. Some products are made to use. These gloves are made to sell at a profit.
customer_reviews.author: Concerned Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Got skin problem
customer_reviews.text: I weard this glove about 1 hour and my left hand got skin issue. Itched and burned. It has been passed a month, but still I have skin problem.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and nice
customer_reviews.text: I teach fluid acrylic painting classes that are super messy! I distribute these nitrite gloves in Large to everyone in the class. They hold up, are sturdy, do the job, and come off easily. I would say all around a great product, as I've gone through at least 4 boxes of 100. I'll continue to buy this brand!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Don't leave fingerprints at the crime scene
customer_reviews.text: Repeat buyer over and over again. I keep some in my RV for dumping tanks. I keep some in my woodshop for painting and staining. I keep some in my car in case I decide to change a tire instead of calling AAA. If I ever commit a crime, I'll toss them on to avoid fingerprints.
customer_reviews.author: Texsox

customer_reviews.title: gloves are okay
customer_reviews.text: gloves are okay, kind of thin but they serve the purpose, protect the hands. the box was contained in a manila envelope with bubbles so when it arrived, the box was busted. am glad the gloves are vacuum packed so they are still inside the box.
customer_reviews.author: LindaA

customer_reviews.title: Great for Tie-Dying
customer_reviews.text: I use these gloves for doing tie-dye. They fit my hands just right and never tear. Just because the sensation of touching things is a little odd with them on, I always do all my “tying” before I put the gloves on.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hall

customer_reviews.title: I would hate to use these for any kind of medical practice
customer_reviews.text: I've just used them just to clean the bathroom so far. I got the large. And they're a little big for me. But still split a couple of times between the thumb, and fore finger. They are too thin. I would hate to use these for any kind of medical practice. For that reason. Going with something thicker next time.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Glove
customer_reviews.text: These are glove they do glove things and are good at that. Dont want to touch meat these gloves can help. Need to pick up dog poop these gloves can help. Want to clean the bathroom (well no one really wants to do that) but these gloves can help. Going to dye your hair these gloves can help Buy these gloves and wear them when you do not want to touch things but have too.
customer_reviews.author: wvbanshee

customer_reviews.title: They're great exam gloves...
customer_reviews.text: mother-in-law needed them to apply a medical ointment /cream... works great and she doesn't;t get the wrong stuff on her hands and transfer to other parts she doesn't;t need the cream on.
customer_reviews.author: Sidney S. Terrell

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I like the nitrile gloves mainly because of the color but also helps me avoid my latex sensitivity and they are pretty sturdy and work well for my many uses. Also comes in varying sizes that actually fit, not say one size and still too little.
customer_reviews.author: Shana

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for Environmental Protection
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item in order to protect myself from germs and bacteria while handling whatsoever. Although one cannot protect their hands from every germ or form of bacteria, it is (still) always a great idea to do your best by having a box of hygienic gloves in one's home, office, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Payne

customer_reviews.title: Does The Job
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are amazing doing the job, long lasting and fit well (L). Multi purpose use around the house, when sick or more currently with the coronavirus19 pandemic to remain safe. Price very affordable and would not be without.
customer_reviews.author: Stargazer

customer_reviews.title: Not Very Strong
customer_reviews.text: I'm not really pleased with these gloves. They tare very easy. We use them around the house for multiple things like cleaning, dusting, etc. and no matter what we use them for they always seem to tare. I don't think I will be purchasing again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Super Mom!

customer_reviews.title: Quality gloves
customer_reviews.text: I have bad eczema on my hands, so I often rely on nitrile gloves when I use any kind of chemical (soap, lotion, shaving cream, etc.). These gloves are good quality, don't tear easily, and go far enough up on the hand to prevent leaking. They are a tiny bit big. I would compare these to XL gloves in other brands. Size down if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica CR

customer_reviews.title: Fits great and stretches like crazy if needed
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a men's large, so that's what I ordered. These things fit like a glove (pun intended.) As long as my hands aren't wet, they slip on and off quite easily and are durable enough for administering an IV to a family member. Keep in mind that these are NOT sterile gloves, they're simply a barrier.
customer_reviews.author: EdFromOhio

customer_reviews.title: Great light-use gloves
customer_reviews.text: I use them when I work on my car, handling meat, working in the garden, everywhere I don't want to get my hands dirty or greasy. They tear pretty easily on edgy surfaces, so don't expect a LOT out of them, but for light tasks they're perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Langis Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Disintegrated
customer_reviews.text: Just be careful how you use them. i tried wearing one on hand to remove toenail polish and the glove disintegrated from the acetone. We use them for all manner of things so I'm not sure about the quality for other uses yet.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Thin gloves, rip easily
customer_reviews.text: I find they rip easily even when putting them on. I will not re-order more. 1 in 4 will tear as putting them on and at this price point, they should be better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Leko 69

customer_reviews.title: Fit and work like they're supposed to
customer_reviews.text: I would purchase again. I use them for protecting my hands around the house, cleaning, etc. They run true to size: I have big hands for a woman and the large are slightly loose (which I wanted).
customer_reviews.author: S. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Fits like a glove
customer_reviews.text: I use ghese for working on my car. Sturdy enough to ladt all day. Grease and oil resistant and tight fitting with no wrinkles. Works for me
customer_reviews.author: John Sengers

customer_reviews.title: Quality seems hit or miss
customer_reviews.text: The first two boxes of these seemed good. Slightly thin, but good. The last box I received however is completely unusable. They stink like sulfur, and leave the smell on your hands also. Completely unusable for anything medical.
customer_reviews.author: CrazyCymbalMonkey

customer_reviews.title: Good Sturdy Gloves 🧤
customer_reviews.text: Great glove, this is my second time purchasing. I use them to apply henna to my hair. So sturdy I can use them more than one time. Also good for doing house work. Highly recommend!!!!
customer_reviews.author: ReaRea

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves - Fit Well
customer_reviews.text: I've run out of luck buying gloves at the store. They are one size fits all (except for me), and they rip easily even after I squeeze them on. These gloves are used at work. They are durable, yet flexible to allow for dexterity.
customer_reviews.author: justjoe

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I used these glove to protect/shield my hands when handling the RV sewer line. One out of three pair tore while using. I used the correct size and I was not impressed the the performance of this product. Next time I will purchase a good pair of leather or vinyl glove and simply reuse them as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Best Nitrile Gloves I've Found So Far
customer_reviews.text: Better than other brands I've tried. I've bought nitrile gloves at Home Depot, Lowes, and other stores, but I keep coming back to these. I use them for a variety of things... Gardening, staining furniture, working on the motorcycle, cleaning the oven, polishing shoes, etc. They always seem to last longer - less holes at the fingertips, less likely to tear if caught on something, however they aren't thicker than other nitriles.
customer_reviews.author: SkierGuy

customer_reviews.title: good for gaming.
customer_reviews.text: my hands get sweaty when I game so wearing gloves helps deal with a whole lot of mess. getting sweat on a mouse pad really sucks when ur playing a shooter since u lose a bunch of traction on the pad and gets really anoying.... after wearing them its helped my gaming out a lot :)!
customer_reviews.author: Salvador Huerta

customer_reviews.title: This product caused no allergic reactions and cleaned the affected areas well.
customer_reviews.text: This product is used for home health care. The store bought baby wipes are not large enough for use with an adult. These are the right size and seem to contain the right amount of non-reactive cleansers. Good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ... they do run a size smaller though.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent food prep gloves ... be warned though that these gloves run small in size ... I have medium sized hands and purchased the large size (just to be safe) and found my hands fit in snugly. Definitely glad I purchased the next size up from my "normal" size selection.
customer_reviews.author: TMM

customer_reviews.title: These are great for working around the house.
customer_reviews.text: These are great for working around the house. I recently ran out of the box of black ones i had. These were $1 cheaper, and I suspect I'll be able to see gobs of black motor oil or grease on these. I use them for everything I need to protect my hands from. Insulation foam, oil changes, vomit, particularly bad dog poops... And the list goes on.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: These Purple Nitrile Exam Gloves are just what I needed for working with the elderly. Not all elderly people are in good health and cleanups are a constant chore. These gloves fit well and come in a tissue type box of 100 gloves. They are thick enough to protect your hands while still offering full mobility of the fingers. The box allows you to grab one glove at a time and is smaller than most other companies thus taking up less space.
customer_reviews.author: minav

customer_reviews.title: Great for food prep
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves, comfortable fit. I use them for food prep--mixing meatloaf, handling dough, greasing pans, portioning chicken parts and fish, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Creampuff

customer_reviews.title: Great Fitting Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Because of medical issues it's become necessary for us to have a good supply of exam gloves on hand. I developed a skin sensitivity to latex after years of wearing latex gloves at my job and these nitrile gloves are a great alternative. They have the feel and fit of latex but I don't get the skin reaction. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Helenedale

customer_reviews.title: They work just as good as any other purple nitrile exam gloves
customer_reviews.text: Product is as described. They work just as good as any other purple nitrile exam gloves. I bought them to use while hooking/un-hooking my camper sewer connections. They are thick enough that as long as you are careful they don't rip when twisting on the sewer connections.
customer_reviews.author: HD

customer_reviews.title: Good Disposable Latex Glove at Reasonable Price.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased these gloves 3 different times. They fit well, are easy to put on and remove, are durable and thequality is excellent. I would recommend them and will buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Moorman

customer_reviews.title: BAD BUSINESS
customer_reviews.text: Stop pretending that your product is worth 250% more money for a 99.98% survival rate cold bug. Reduce the price, companies like yours are get what you deserve.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Thielman

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves!
customer_reviews.text: We keep a box of these around the home for a variety of uses. The primary use is my kids wear them to pick up the dog poop in the yard with their hands and place them in bags for disposal. These work perfectly for that! No complaints at all.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas E. Kaiser

customer_reviews.title: Great for handling chemicals
customer_reviews.text: Handy gloves for all sorts of stuff. I use mostly for waxing my car. Great for handling chemicals. Good quality rubber gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Allergy/Rash Free!
customer_reviews.text: All of a sudden latex gloves gave me a bad rash all up my arms! So we tried these and no rash! If you have problems with rash from other gloves, definitely give these a try!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonJunkie

customer_reviews.title: Useful product.
customer_reviews.text: Have only had for a short time so can't comment on durability. They work well for home care purposes.
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are nice and sturdy they do last I use them to clean or use them to dye my hair. use them if I’m going to paint and does not go through your glove
customer_reviews.author: Ruby

customer_reviews.title: good for one oil change and it break for the ...
customer_reviews.text: It does not last. somehow, it will break if you wear it for couple hours. I will say, good for one oil change and it break for the 2nd car. Is ok to use to pick up something that you really don't want to touch it and throw it away as soon as you can.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Kwong

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: These are the best gloves, I use them for everything. They are easy to get on and off, I got the large size and it is perfect
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Not Strong
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like the fact that they were not as strong as I thought they would. They tear too easily.
customer_reviews.author: Naybo

customer_reviews.title: Only durable enough for medical use.
customer_reviews.text: Break too easily. I was using these to detail my cars and leave oily fingerprints on the body but even for basic car washing they would tear throw multiple pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Chavana

customer_reviews.title: I use these for everything
customer_reviews.text: I use these for cleaning guns, working on vehicles, painting, etc. they hold up good and fit me well
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H.

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but thin
customer_reviews.text: I tend to wear gloves like this for messy jobs, like staining wood. They work well and protect my hands. But, I wouldn't use them for something where gripping is critical. Like an oil change. They are very thin and tear with any kind of pressure and torque. I've had them tear just putting them on.
customer_reviews.author: Todd H

customer_reviews.title: Great for cleaning and crafting
customer_reviews.text: I use these for cleaning the bathroom and picking up trash outside. Very durable and well made.
customer_reviews.author: HollyD

customer_reviews.title: Long time user, and they were great until this most recent box.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased this product 10+ times and it has always been on point. Most recently I opened a new box and it emitted a disgusting burnt chemical smell. Some smell with gloves is always normal, but this was absolutely out of the ordinary and disgusting. I ordered two boxes, will updated if this is some one off mistake. Otherwise I will have to make a change unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Justin S.

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves! They have stretch and are a great thickness!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was hoping they would be! I use them for overnight hand moisturizing. I have diabetes, and use these for overnight moisturizing. I've already bought my second box, these are wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Fit well and are thick
customer_reviews.text: These are the best gloves ever. We buy them over and over again. They fit great and are nice and thick. We use them for changing an elderly family member and they are our "go to gloves"
customer_reviews.author: Diane R. Jasso

customer_reviews.title: Fits like an exam glove should
customer_reviews.text: Rips easily and hand don't really breath in these, so if you're working in these things expect soaked hands and a tear to the gloves soon there after. good for short tasks i suppose
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Good fit but they don't wear well.
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased several boxes if nitrile gloves in this price range. This box was the worst yet. The gloves just fall apart after minimal use. Won't be buying this one again.
customer_reviews.author: jnetTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: thumb ripped while cleaning microwave
customer_reviews.text: very thin material. Might be great if you are painting but if the glove will come in contact with anything like scrubbing the counter or washing dishes its probably going to tear easily. Ill use mine for painting but not for cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: Great all purpose disposable gloves
customer_reviews.text: I use these gloves for almost everything from changing soiled diapers to cleaning cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Tomtom

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I like nitrile gloves because you can use them several times before tossing in the recycling. But with these I get only a few uses before the fingertips open up and it's gone time. So these are midgrade gloves at best.
customer_reviews.author: rommyc

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and fit. I've paid more for the same med glove by other brands. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Ann Palomo

customer_reviews.title: THIS GLOVE IS THE PERFECT CHOICE
customer_reviews.text: With all these type products that are available on Amazon, it was difficult to choose which gloves would be the best choice. Am VERY happy with my choice of this particular glove. They are a very good weight without being too heavy PLUS the fact there are 100 gloves in each box makes them an excellent choice!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price, fingers went through the ends if used in a non gentle manner.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Love the product.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love the product. As good as was advertised. Delivery was prompt and well-packaged. Will definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SCHOOL PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: I order Amazon for a public school district. This must be okay to recommend b/c I didn't hear any complaints (and believe me I would have.)
customer_reviews.author: CJ Harris

customer_reviews.title: Works as they should
customer_reviews.text: Good product for cleaning firearms and detailing and working on our vehicles. Keeps chemicals off your hands and are disposable.
customer_reviews.author: Will's Mommy

customer_reviews.title: GREAT GLOVES
customer_reviews.text: I use these gloves for various projects around the house including painting, hand mixing food, touching raw meats or whenever I don't want dirty hands. Works like a charm. They have a loose fit. I ordered a large which is my normal size.
customer_reviews.author: Skycatcher

customer_reviews.title: These are good gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Other than this being a strange color for gloves, I found these to be very durable and they fit my large hands well.
customer_reviews.author: Tom & Emily

customer_reviews.title: good gloves
customer_reviews.text: Purchase these gloves to feed my ailing cat his medicines. gloves are good. size is loose, which is excellent. I also use these gloves for cleaning around the house as they are hypo-allergenic
customer_reviews.author: sapphireheart

customer_reviews.title: Nice - Good Fit - Durable.
customer_reviews.text: I use these whenever dealing with chemicals or crap I don't want on my hands (motor oil). Work well, seem to be very durable so far. Cheap enough to discard.
customer_reviews.author: Web Geek

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent in fit and durability for light work. Saves on the hands and keeps germs away.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: A better glove for a $1 more than cheaper HFT
customer_reviews.text: Basically bought these to see if the are less resistant to tearing than the Harbor Freight gloves that I use for crafts. Both are nitrile but these hold up better and are med/exam grade but not sterile.
customer_reviews.author: TexasGEEK

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This will be the 3rd time ordering these gloves. Use them for cooking, grilling, cleaning, working in the car, great for chopping spicy peppers. Always have these in my house!
customer_reviews.author: Peeps

product_meta.title: The Safety Zone GNEP-LG-1P Nitrile Exam Gloves - Medical Grade, Powder Free, Latex Rubber Free, Disposable, Non Sterile, Food Safe, Textured, Indigo Color, Convenient Dispenser Pack of 100, Size Large
product_meta.description: Consistent quality and reliability - For over 40 years, The Safety Zone has been an industry leader, known for technical expertise, manufacturing processes and quality control - Guaranteed!
feature_bullets: Excellent hand and personal protection. Nitrile is chemical and puncture-resistant providing a higher level of protection against liquids, gases and sharp objects. Non-allergenic and non-irritating.

Excellent fit, good sensitivity and dexterity for fine tasks. The entire glove is finely textured (including palms and fingers) to provide consistent grip on glass wear, small objects, instruments and tools.
Ambidextrous (fits right or left hand). Rolled cuff for easy opening, quick donning and fast removal. Convenient dispense pack keeps gloves clean and organized while providing easy access.
Ideal for almost any application including basic medical procedures, lab work, hair coloring, tattooing, food preparation, painting, cleaning, pet care, home improvement, hobbies, arts and crafts.
Consistent quality and reliability - For over 40 years, The Safety Zone has been an industry leader, known for technical expertise, manufacturing processes and quality control - Guaranteed!
